tools.name: Add multiple content blocks (bulk, user-friendly)
tools.description: Bulk-add content blocks to Notion. CRITICAL: Notion API enforces 2000 char limit per text.content field. Features: - Accepts simplified format: {'content': 'text', 'block_property': 'type'} - OR full Notion block format with 'type' and properties - AUTO-SPLITS text >2000 chars into multiple blocks - AUTO-PARSES markdown: **bold**, *italic*, ~~strike~~, `inline code`, [links](url) - Maximum 100 blocks per API call REQUIRED 'content' for: paragraph, heading_1-3, callout, to_do, toggle, quote, list items. For code blocks use full format: {'type': 'code', 'code': {'rich_text': [...], 'language': 'python'}} Common errors: - "content.length should be ≤ 2000": Auto-split failed, manually split content - "Content is required": Missing content for text blocks - Each item MUST be wrapped in 'content_block' field

after.description: Identifier of an existing block. The new content blocks will be appended immediately after this block. If omitted or null, the new blocks are appended to the end of the parent's children list.
after.title: After

content_blocks.description:
⚠️ CRITICAL: Notion API enforces 2000 char limit per text.content field. Content >2000 chars auto-splits.
List of blocks to add (max 100). Each item MUST have 'content_block' field containing either:
1) Simplified: {'content': 'text (REQUIRED for text blocks)', 'block_property': 'type'} OR
2) Full Notion: {'type': 'code', 'code': {...}} for complex blocks.
Auto-features: Markdown parsing (**bold** *italic* ~~strike~~ `code` [link](url)), text splitting at 2000 chars.
Valid block_property values: paragraph, heading_1-3, callout, to_do, toggle, quote, bulleted/numbered_list_item.
NOTE: 'code' blocks require full Notion format, not simplified.
content_blocks.title: Content Blocks

items.description: Represents a single content block that can be added to a Notion page.
items.title: MultipleContentBlock

content_block.description:
Include these fields in the json: {'content': 'Some words', 'link': 'https://random-link.com'. For content styling, refer to https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text.

ENHANCED: The 'content' field now automatically detects and parses markdown formatting - supports bold (**text**), italic (*text*), strikethrough (~~text~~), inline code (`code`), and links ([text](url)). Headers (# ## ###) are handled via block_property.
content_block.title: NotionRichText

block_property.description: The block property of the block to be added. Possible properties are `paragraph`, `heading_1`, `heading_2`, `heading_3`, `callout`, `to_do`, `toggle`, `quote`, `bulleted_list_item`, `numbered_list_item`. Other properties possible are `file`, `image`, `video` (link required).
block_property.title: Block Property

tools.name: Add single content block to Notion page (Deprecated)
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Use 'add_multiple_page_content' for better performance. Adds a single content block to a Notion page/block. CRITICAL: Notion API enforces a HARD LIMIT of 2000 characters per text.content field. Content exceeding 2000 chars is AUTOMATICALLY SPLIT into multiple sequential blocks. REQUIRED 'content' field for text blocks: paragraph, heading_1-3, callout, to_do, toggle, quote, list items. Parent blocks MUST be: Page, Toggle, To-do, Bulleted/Numbered List Item, Callout, or Quote. Common errors: - "content.length should be ≤ 2000": Text exceeds API limit (should be auto-handled) - "Content is required for paragraph blocks": Missing 'content' field for text blocks - "object_not_found": Invalid parent_block_id or no integration access For bulk operations, use 'add_multiple_page_content' instead.

tools.name: Append raw Notion blocks (advanced API)
tools.description: Appends raw Notion API blocks to parent. CRITICAL: Text content limited to 2000 chars per text.content field. Use for: Advanced blocks (tables, databases), pre-built block objects, complex nested structures. REQUIRES exact Notion block schema - each block MUST have 'object':'block' and 'type'. Text blocks MUST use rich_text arrays: {'rich_text': [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'text'}}]} Common errors: - "content.length should be ≤ 2000": Text exceeds API limit, split into multiple blocks - "validation_error": Using 'text' instead of 'rich_text' for headings/paragraphs - "object_not_found": Invalid block_id or no integration access - Missing 'object': 'block' or 'type' fields For simple content, use 'add_multiple_page_content' instead - it handles formatting automatically.

after.description: Optional UUID of an existing child block. New blocks will be inserted after this block. Must be a valid child block ID of the parent block. If omitted, blocks are appended at the end. Do not use placeholder values like '<block_id>' or invalid IDs.
after.title: After

block_id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the parent block or page to append children to. Must be a valid Notion block/page ID in UUID format (with or without hyphens). Use NOTION_FETCH_DATA to find valid page IDs. Do not use placeholder values.
block_id.title: Block Id

children.description:
⚠️ CRITICAL: Notion API enforces 2000 char limit per text.content field in rich_text arrays.
Array of block objects following Notion's block schema. Each block MUST include:
- 'object': 'block' (REQUIRED)
- 'type': block type (REQUIRED)
- Property matching type name with 'rich_text' array for text blocks

Pass an actual array of objects, NOT a JSON string. The parameter expects a list/array type, not a stringified JSON.

Text blocks (paragraph, heading_1-3, etc.) MUST use 'rich_text' array structure:
{'rich_text': [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'your text here (max 2000 chars)'}}]}

Common errors:
- Passing a JSON string instead of an array (WRONG: '"[{...}]"' | CORRECT: [{...}])
- Using 'text' instead of 'rich_text' (WRONG: heading_2: {'text': ...})
- Missing 'object': 'block' field
- Text content exceeding 2000 characters
- Malformed rich_text array structure

Max 100 blocks per request.
children.title: Children

inputParameters.description: Request model for appending child blocks to an existing block.

block.description: Additional metadata carrier for block operations. Optional and may be empty.
block.title: Block

tools.name: Create Notion Database
tools.description: Creates a new Notion database as a subpage under a specified parent page with a defined properties schema. IMPORTANT NOTES: - The parent page MUST be shared with your integration, otherwise you'll get a 404 error - If you encounter conflict errors (409), retry the request as Notion may experience temporary save conflicts - For relation properties, you MUST provide the database_id of the related database - Parent ID must be a valid UUID format (with or without hyphens), not a template variable Use this action exclusively for creating new databases.

parent_id.description: Identifier of the existing Notion page that will contain the new database. Must be a valid 32-character UUID with hyphens (format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx) or 32-character string without hyphens. The page must be shared with your integration. Do not use template variables like {{prev.0.response.data.results[0].id}} - provide the actual UUID value. Can be obtained using search functionalities or the `NOTION_FETCH_DATA` action.
parent_id.title: Parent Id

properties.description: A list defining the schema (columns) for the new database. Each item in the list is an object representing a property and must specify at least its 'name' (how it will appear in Notion) and 'type' (the kind of data it will hold). Refer to the `PropertySchema` model for full structure details. At least one property of type 'title' is generally required. Common supported property types include: 'title', 'rich_text', 'number', 'select', 'multi_select', 'status', 'date', 'people', 'files', 'checkbox', 'url', 'email', 'phone_number'. Other types like 'formula', 'relation', 'rollup', 'created_time', 'created_by', 'last_edited_time', 'last_edited_by' might also be supported. IMPORTANT: For 'relation' type properties, you MUST also provide the 'database_id' field with the UUID of the related database. The related database must be shared with your integration.
properties.title: Properties

type.title: Type

tools.name: Create Notion page
tools.description: Creates a new empty page in a Notion workspace under a specified parent page or database. PREREQUISITES: - Parent page/database must exist and be accessible in your Notion workspace - Use search_pages or list_databases first to obtain valid parent IDs LIMITATIONS: - Cannot create root-level pages (must have a parent) - May encounter conflicts if creating pages too quickly - Title-based parent search is less reliable than using UUIDs

parent_id.description: CRITICAL: Must be either: 1) A valid UUID (format: 8-4-4-4-12 hex characters like '59833787-2cf9-4fdf-8782-e53db20768a5') of an existing Notion page or database. 2) The exact title of an existing page/database (less reliable - UUID strongly preferred). IMPORTANT: Always use search_pages or list_databases actions FIRST to obtain valid parent IDs. Common errors: Using malformed UUIDs, non-existent IDs, or IDs from different workspaces. Note: Root-level pages cannot be created - you must specify a parent.

tools.name: Fetch All Notion Block Contents
tools.description: Tool to fetch all child blocks for a given Notion block. Use when you need a complete listing of a block's children beyond a single page; supports optional recursive expansion of nested blocks.

block_id.description: Identifier (UUID) of the parent Notion block or page whose children to list. Pages are blocks in Notion; use actions like 'NOTION_FETCH_DATA' to locate relevant block/page IDs.
block_id.title: Block Id

page_size.description: Maximum number of child blocks to return per request. Defaults to 100, with a maximum of 100 as per Notion API limits.
page_size.title: Page Size

recursive.description: If true, fetches nested children for blocks with 'has_children' set to true, appending all descendants to the output list.
recursive.title: Recursive

inputParameters.title: FetchAllBlockContentsRequest
inputParameters.description: Request parameters for fetching all block children with optional recursion.

blocks.description: Flat list of child block objects. If 'recursive' was true, includes all nested descendants.
blocks.title: Blocks

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Fetch Notion Block Children
tools.description: Retrieves a paginated list of direct, first-level child block objects along with contents for a given parent Notion block or page ID; use block IDs from the response for subsequent calls to access deeply nested content.

block_id.description: Identifier (UUID) of the parent Notion block or page whose children are to be fetched. This ID can be for a block or a page (as pages are blocks). To obtain relevant IDs and their titles, consider using actions like 'NOTION_FETCH_DATA' or other actions that list pages or database content.
block_id.title: Block Id

page_size.description: The maximum number of child blocks to return in a single response. The actual number of results may be lower if there are fewer child blocks available or if the end of the list is reached. Maximum allowed value is 100. If unspecified, Notion's default page size will be used.
page_size.title: Page Size

start_cursor.description: An opaque string. If provided, the response will list blocks starting from the position indicated by this cursor. If omitted, the first page of results is returned. Essential for paginating through a large number of child blocks.
start_cursor.title: Start Cursor

has_more.description: True if there are more results available; false otherwise.
has_more.title: Has More

next_cursor.description: Cursor to pass as start_cursor to request the next page. Null if there is no next page.
next_cursor.title: Next Cursor

results.description: Array of child Block objects at the first nesting level for the given parent block.
results.title: Results

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Fetch Notion block metadata
tools.description: Fetches metadata for a Notion block (including pages, which are special blocks) using its UUID. Returns block type, properties, and basic info but not child content. Prerequisites: 1) Block/page must be shared with your integration, 2) Use valid block_id from API responses (not URLs). For child blocks, use fetch_block_contents instead. Common 404 errors mean the block isn't accessible to your integration.

block_id.description: The unique UUID identifier for the Notion block to be retrieved. Must be a valid 32-character UUID (with or without hyphens). Pages in Notion are also blocks, so page IDs work here too. Important: The block/page must be shared with your integration. To find valid block IDs, use actions like search_pages, list_databases, or fetch_block_contents. Common error: Ensure you're using the actual block_id from API responses, not URLs or other identifiers.
block_id.title: Block Id

tools.name: Insert row database
tools.description: Creates a new page (row) in a specified Notion database. Prerequisites: - The database must be explicitly shared with your Notion integration - Property names and types must match the database schema exactly - Select/multi-select options must already exist in the database Common Errors: - 404 "Could not find database": Database is not shared with your integration - 400 "Status is not a property": Using 'status' type incorrectly (use 'select' instead) - Validation error on properties: Properties must be provided as a list, not a dictionary

child_blocks.description: A list of `NotionRichText` objects defining content blocks (e.g., paragraphs, headings) to append to the new page's body. If omitted, the page body will be empty.
child_blocks.title: Child Blocks

items.description:
Include these fields in the json: {'content': 'Some words', 'link': 'https://random-link.com'. For content styling, refer to https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text.

ENHANCED: The 'content' field now automatically detects and parses markdown formatting - supports bold (**text**), italic (*text*), strikethrough (~~text~~), inline code (`code`), and links ([text](url)). Headers (# ## ###) are handled via block_property.
items.title: NotionRichText

block_property.description: The block property of the block to be added. Possible properties are `paragraph`, `heading_1`, `heading_2`, `heading_3`, `callout`, `to_do`, `toggle`, `quote`, `bulleted_list_item`, `numbered_list_item`. Other properties possible are `file`, `image`, `video` (link required).
block_property.title: Block Property

bold.description: Indicates if the text is bold.
bold.title: Bold

code.description: Indicates if the text is formatted as code.
code.title: Code

color.description: The color of the text background or text itself.
color.title: Color

content.description: The textual content of the rich text object. ENHANCED: Now automatically parses markdown formatting including bold (**text**), italic (*text*), strikethrough (~~text~~), inline code (`code`), and links ([text](url)). Required for paragraph, heading_1, heading_2, heading_3, callout, to_do, toggle, quote.
content.title: Content

italic.description: Indicates if the text is italic.
italic.title: Italic

link.description: The URL of the rich text object or the file to be uploaded or image/video link
link.title: Link

strikethrough.description: Indicates if the text has strikethrough.
strikethrough.title: Strikethrough

underline.description: Indicates if the text is underlined.
underline.title: Underline

cover.description: URL of an external image to set as the page cover. The URL must point to a publicly accessible image.
cover.title: Cover

database_id.description: Identifier (UUID) of the Notion database where the new page (row) will be inserted. This ID must correspond to an existing database that has been explicitly shared with your integration. IMPORTANT: The database must be shared with your integration in Notion settings, otherwise you will get a 404 error. Use the `NOTION_FETCH_DATA` action to find available database IDs that are already shared with your integration.
database_id.title: Database Id

icon.description: Emoji to be used as the page icon. Must be a single emoji character.
icon.title: Icon

properties.description:
Property values for the new page. ⚠️ CRITICAL: This field requires a LIST of objects, not a dictionary. Each object in the list defines a property and must include: `name` (the exact name of the property as it appears in Notion), `type` (the property's data type), and `value` (the property's value, formatted as a string according to its type).

CORRECT FORMAT EXAMPLE (a list of property objects):
[
  {"name": "Title", "type": "title", "value": "My new task"},
  {"name": "Status", "type": "select", "value": "In Progress"},
  {"name": "Tags", "type": "multi_select", "value": "Work,Personal"},
  {"name": "Due Date", "type": "date", "value": "2024-06-01T12:00:00.000-04:00"},
  {"name": "Completed", "type": "checkbox", "value": "False"}
]

INCORRECT FORMAT (dictionary format - will cause validation error):
{
  "Title": "My new task",
  "Status": "In Progress"
}

⚠️ IMPORTANT PROPERTY TYPE NOTES:
- `status`: This is a SPECIAL Notion property type (introduced in 2024). Use `type: 'select'` for regular dropdown properties instead.
  The status property type has special behavior and should only be used if your database specifically has a Status property type.
- If you see 'Status is not a property that exists' error, it means you should use `select` type instead of `status` type.

Value formatting rules by property type:
- `title` or `rich_text`: Plain text string (maximum 2000 characters).
- `number`: String representation of a number (e.g., "23.4").
- `select`: The name of an existing option for the select property (e.g., "In Progress"). 
  NOTE: The option must already exist in the database schema.
- `multi_select`: Comma-separated string of existing option names (e.g., "Work,Personal").
  NOTE: All options must already exist in the database schema.
- `date`: ISO 8601 formatted date string (e.g., "2024-06-01T12:00:00.000-04:00").
- `people`: Comma-separated string of Notion user IDs.
- `checkbox`: String "True" or "False".
- `url`: A valid URL string.
- `files`: Comma-separated string of URLs.
- `email`: A valid email string.
- `phone_number`: A phone number string.

Properties defined in the database schema but omitted from this list will be initialized with default or empty values. Ensure that property names and types correctly match the target database schema. Property names are case-sensitive.
properties.title: Properties

type.description: Type of the property. Type of the propertytitle, rich_text, number, select, multi_select, date, people, files, checkbox url, email, phone_number, formula, created_by, created_time, last_edited_by, last_edited_time
type.title: Type

value.description:
Value of the property, it will be dependent on the type of the property
For types --> value should be
- title, rich_text - text ex. "Hello World" (IMPORTANT: max 2000 characters, longer text will be truncated)
- number - number ex. 23.4
- select - select ex. "India"
- multi_select - multi_select comma separated values ex. "India,USA"
- date - format ex. "2021-05-11T11:00:00.000-04:00",
- people - comma separated ids of people ex. "123,456" (will be converted to array of user objects)
- relation - comma separated ids of related pages ex. "123,456" (will be converted to array of relation objects)
- url - a url.
- files - comma separated urls
- checkbox - "True" or "False"
value.title: Value

tools.name: Query database
tools.description: Queries a Notion database to retrieve pages (rows). In Notion, databases are collections where each row is a page and columns are properties. Returns paginated results with metadata. Important requirements: - The database must be shared with your integration - Property names in sorts must match existing database properties exactly (case-sensitive) - The start_cursor must be a valid UUID from a previous response's next_cursor field - Database IDs must be valid 32-character UUIDs (with or without hyphens) Use this action to: - Retrieve all or filtered database entries - Sort results by one or more properties - Paginate through large result sets - Get database content for processing or display

database_id.description: The UUID of the Notion database to query (32 character hexadecimal string, optionally with hyphens). The database must be shared with your integration. You can find the database ID in the database URL or use actions like `NOTION_FETCH_DATA` to list available databases. Format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx or xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
database_id.title: Database Id

page_size.description: Number of items (database rows/pages) to return per request. Valid range: 1-100. Default is 100. The API may return fewer items than requested if that's all that's available.
page_size.title: Page Size

sorts.description: List of sort rules to order the database query results. Each sort rule must specify: 'property_name' (exact name of an existing database property) and 'ascending' (True/False). Properties must exist in the database and names must match exactly (case-sensitive). Multiple sorts are applied in the order specified.
sorts.title: Sorts

ascending.description: Sort direction: True for ascending (A→Z, oldest→newest), False for descending (Z→A, newest→oldest).
ascending.title: Ascending

property_name.description: The exact name of a database property/column to sort by. Must match an existing property name in the database exactly (case-sensitive). Common properties include 'Name', 'Title', 'Created time', 'Last edited time', etc.
property_name.title: Property Name

start_cursor.description: A pagination cursor for fetching the next page of results. Must be a valid UUID string (format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx) obtained from the 'next_cursor' field of a previous query response. Do not use placeholder values. If omitted, returns the first page.
start_cursor.title: Start Cursor

response_data.description: The query response containing: 'results' (array of Page or Data source objects), 'has_more', 'next_cursor', and optional Notion pagination metadata fields.
response_data.title: Response Data

data_source.description: Present only if 'type' is 'data_source'. Reserved for pagination metadata; empty for this endpoint.
data_source.title: Data Source

has_more.description: Whether there are more results after this page.
has_more.title: Has More

next_cursor.description: Cursor used to request the next page of results; null if there are no more results.
next_cursor.title: Next Cursor

object.description: Indicates a paginated list response; always 'list'.
object.title: Object

page.description: Present only if 'type' is 'page'. Reserved for pagination metadata; empty for this endpoint.
page.title: Page

page_or_database.description: Present when 'type' is 'page_or_database'. Type-specific pagination metadata; often an empty object.
page_or_database.title: Page Or Database

request_id.description: Optional server-generated unique identifier for the request (observed in real responses).
request_id.title: Request Id

results.description: List of results for the query. For most data sources, each item is a Page object. For wiki data sources, items can be Page objects and/or Data source objects.
results.title: Results

type.description: Optional type discriminator for the items in results. Generally 'page'. For wiki data sources, can be 'page' or 'data_source'. May also be 'page_or_database' per observed responses.
type.title: Type

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not

filter.description: Filter object to limit returned entries. Supports single-property filters or compound filters using `and`/`or`. See Notion API docs for details.

page_size.description: Maximum number of items to return (1–100). Defaults to 100 if omitted.

sorts.description: List of sort criteria in order of precedence. Mix PropertySort and TimestampSort.

filter_properties.description: List of property IDs to include in each returned item; maps to the `filter_properties[]` query parameter.

tools.name: Search Notion page
tools.description: Searches Notion pages and databases by title; an empty query lists all accessible items, useful for discovering IDs or as a fallback when a specific query yields no results.

direction.description: Specifies the sort direction for the results. Required if `timestamp` is provided. Valid values are `ascending` or `descending`.
direction.title: Direction

filter_property.description: The property to filter the search results by. Currently, the only supported value is `object`, which filters by the type specified in `filter_value`. Defaults to `object`.
filter_property.title: Filter Property

filter_value.description: Filters the search results by object type. Valid values are `page` or `database`. Defaults to `page`.
filter_value.title: Filter Value

page_size.description: The number of items to include in the response. Must be an integer between 1 and 100, inclusive. Defaults to 2.
page_size.title: Page Size

query.description: The text to search for in page and database titles. If an empty string is provided, all pages and databases accessible to the integration will be returned.
query.title: Query

start_cursor.description: An opaque cursor value returned in a previous response. If provided, the API will return results starting after this cursor, enabling pagination. If `None` or an empty string, results start from the beginning.
start_cursor.title: Start Cursor

timestamp.description: The timestamp field to sort the results by. Currently, the only supported value is `last_edited_time`. If provided, `direction` must also be specified.
timestamp.title: Timestamp

has_more.description: True if there are more results after this page; otherwise false.
has_more.title: Has More

next_cursor.description: A cursor to be used as start_cursor for the next page of results, or null if there are no more results.
next_cursor.title: Next Cursor

page_or_database.description: Optional union container present in some API versions when type == 'page_or_database'. Typically an empty object for list responses.
page_or_database.title: Page Or Database

results.description: Array of search results. Each item is either a Page or a Data source object. In some integrations using older API versions, Database objects may also appear.
results.title: Results

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Update block
tools.description: Updates existing Notion block's text content. ⚠️ CRITICAL: Content limited to 2000 chars. Cannot change block type or archive blocks. Content exceeding 2000 chars will fail with validation error. For longer content, split across multiple blocks using add_multiple_page_content.

additional_properties.description: Optional dictionary of type-specific properties. Common examples: 'checked' (boolean) for to_do blocks to mark complete/incomplete, 'color' (string like 'blue_background', 'gray', 'red') for text styling, 'is_toggleable' (boolean) for heading blocks to make them collapsible. NOTE: Cannot use 'archived' here - use NOTION_DELETE_BLOCK to remove blocks instead.
additional_properties.title: Additional Properties

block_id.description: Identifier of the Notion block to be updated. To find a block's ID, other Notion actions that list or retrieve blocks can be used. For updating content within a page (which is also a block), its ID can be obtained using actions like `NOTION_FETCH_DATA` to get page IDs and titles.
block_id.title: Block Id

block_type.description: The type of the block being updated. IMPORTANT: This must match the EXISTING block's type - you cannot change a block's type through this action. Must be one of the supported types: 'paragraph', 'heading_1', 'heading_2', 'heading_3', 'bulleted_list_item', 'numbered_list_item', 'to_do', 'toggle'. To verify a block's type, use the NOTION_GET_BLOCK action first.
block_type.title: Block Type

content.description: The new text content for the block. Replaces existing text content entirely. ⚠️ CRITICAL: Notion API enforces a HARD LIMIT of 2000 characters per text.content field. Content exceeding 2000 chars will cause a validation error. For longer content, split across multiple blocks using append_block_children or add_multiple_page_content.
content.title: Content
examples: This is the updated line of text.

inputParameters.title: UpdateBlockRequest
inputParameters.description: Input parameters for updating a Notion block.

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Update Page
tools.description: Update page properties, icon, cover, or archive status. Requires at least one update parameter. Common errors: - "Invalid property identifier": Property name doesn't exist - use exact names from your database - "should be defined": Property value missing wrapper - always wrap: {'Field': {'type': value}} - "Input should be a valid dictionary": Properties must be dict, not list Property formats by type: - title/rich_text: {'text': {'content': 'value'}} - select/status: {'name': 'option'} - url: plain string needs {'url': 'string'} wrapper - number: plain number needs {'number': value} wrapper

archived.description: Set to true to archive (trash) the page, false to restore. At least one of properties, archived, icon, or cover is required.
archived.title: Archived

cover.description: Page cover (external file only). At least one of properties, archived, icon, or cover is required.
cover.title: Cover

icon.description: Page icon object. At least one of properties, archived, icon, or cover is required.
icon.title: Icon

page_id.description: Identifier for the Notion page to be updated.
page_id.title: Page Id

properties.description: Dictionary mapping property names to property value objects. Keys must match exact property names from your Notion database (case-sensitive). Values must be wrapped in property type objects - never send plain values. Example: {'Status': {'select': {'name': 'Done'}}} not {'Status': 'Done'}. At least one of properties, archived, icon, or cover is required.
properties.title: Properties

created_time.description: Date and time when the page was created.
created_time.title: Created Time

in_trash.description: Whether the page is in Trash.
in_trash.title: In Trash

last_edited_by.description: User who last edited the page.
last_edited_by.title: Last Edited By

last_edited_time.description: Date and time when the page was last edited.
last_edited_time.title: Last Edited Time

object.description: Type of object. Always "page" for page objects.
object.title: Object

parent.description: Information about the parent of this page.
parent.title: Parent

public_url.description: Public page URL if published to web; otherwise null.
public_url.title: Public Url

url.description: The URL of the Notion page.
url.title: Url

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Update row database
tools.description: Updates a Notion database row (page) by its UUID. Common issues: (1) Use UUID from page URL, not the full URL, (2) Ensure page is shared with integration, (3) Match property names exactly as in database, (4) Use 'status' type for Status properties, not 'select', (5) Retry on 409 Conflict errors (concurrent updates). Supports updating properties, icon, cover, or archiving the row.

cover.description: URL of an external image to be used as the cover for the page (e.g., 'https://google.com/image.png').
cover.title: Cover

delete_row.description: If true, the row (page) will be archived, effectively deleting it from the active view. If false, the row will be updated with other provided data.
delete_row.title: Delete Row

icon.description: The emoji to be used as the icon for the page. Must be a single emoji character (e.g., '😻', '🤔').
icon.title: Icon

properties.description: List of properties to update. Each property requires: (1) 'name' - exact property name as shown in Notion, (2) 'type' - the property type (title, rich_text, number, select, status, multi_select, date, people, relation, checkbox, url, email, phone_number), (3) 'value' - formatted according to type. IMPORTANT: Verify property names exist in the database and match the exact case. Use 'status' type for Status properties, NOT 'select'. Properties not listed will remain unchanged. Note: Concurrent updates may cause 409 Conflict errors - retry if this occurs.
properties.title: Properties

type.description: Type of the property. Type of the propertytitle, rich_text, number, select, multi_select, date, people, files, checkbox url, email, phone_number, formula, created_by, created_time, last_edited_by, last_edited_time
type.title: Type

value.description:
Value of the property, it will be dependent on the type of the property
For types --> value should be
- title, rich_text - text ex. "Hello World" (IMPORTANT: max 2000 characters, longer text will be truncated)
- number - number ex. 23.4
- select - select ex. "India"
- multi_select - multi_select comma separated values ex. "India,USA"
- date - format ex. "2021-05-11T11:00:00.000-04:00",
- people - comma separated ids of people ex. "123,456" (will be converted to array of user objects)
- relation - comma separated ids of related pages ex. "123,456" (will be converted to array of relation objects)
- url - a url.
- files - comma separated urls
- checkbox - "True" or "False"
value.title: Value

row_id.description: The UUID of the Notion page (database row) to update. MUST be a 32-character UUID with hyphens (e.g., '59833787-2cf9-4fdf-8782-e53db20768a5'). NOT a URL or page title. You can find this ID in the page URL after the workspace name, or via the 'Copy link' option. The page must be shared with your integration for access. Format: 8-4-4-4-12 hexadecimal characters separated by hyphens.
row_id.title: Row Id

response_data.description: The updated Notion Page object representing the modified database row.
response_data.title: Response Data

type.description: Optional user type: 'person' or 'bot'.
type.title: Type

is_locked.description: Whether the page is locked. Not officially documented.
is_locked.title: Is Locked

type.description: Optional user type: 'person' or 'bot'.
type.title: Type

properties.description: Map of property values keyed by property name.
properties.title: Properties

request_id.description: X-Request-Id surfaced by the integration when available.
request_id.title: Request Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Update database schema
tools.description: Updates an existing Notion database's schema including title, description, and/or properties (columns). IMPORTANT NOTES: - At least one update (title, description, or properties) must be provided - The database must be shared with your integration - Property names are case-sensitive and must match exactly - When changing a property to 'relation' type, you MUST provide the database_id of the target database - Removing properties will permanently delete that column and its data - Use NOTION_FETCH_DATA first to get the exact property names and database structure Common errors: - 'database_id' missing: Ensure you're passing the database_id parameter (not page_id) - 'data_source_id' undefined: When changing to relation type, database_id is required in PropertySchemaUpdate - Property name mismatch: Names must match exactly including case and special characters

database_id.description: REQUIRED: The UUID identifier of the Notion database to update. This must be a valid database ID that is shared with your integration. Use NOTION_FETCH_DATA or similar actions to get available database IDs. Format: UUID with or without hyphens (e.g., 'd9824bdc-8445-4327-be8b-554d41f30b60').
database_id.title: Database Id

description.description: New description for the database. Leave as None or omit to keep the existing description unchanged. This updates the description text shown below the database title.
description.title: Description

properties.description:
List of property (column) updates for the database schema. Each PropertySchemaUpdate must specify: 
1) 'name': The EXACT case-sensitive name of the existing property
2) One of these actions:
   - 'rename': Change the property name
   - 'new_type': Change the property type (see PropertySchemaUpdate for valid types)
   - 'remove': Set to true to delete the property
IMPORTANT: When changing a property to 'relation' type, you MUST also provide 'database_id' with the UUID of the target database to link to.
Example: [{'name': 'Status', 'new_type': 'select'}, {'name': 'Tasks', 'new_type': 'relation', 'database_id': 'abc123...'}]
properties.title: Properties

database_id.description: ID of the database to relate to. REQUIRED when new_type is 'relation'. This is the UUID of the target database that this relation property will link to. Note: Internally, Notion's PATCH API refers to this as 'data_source_id', but we use 'database_id' here for consistency with the CREATE operation.
database_id.title: Database Id

name.description: Name of the existing property to update. This must match the exact case-sensitive name of the property in the database.
name.title: Name

new_type.description: New type for the property. If None (default), the type remains unchanged. Valid types: title, rich_text, number, select, multi_select, date, people, files, checkbox, url, email, phone_number, formula, relation, created_by, created_time, last_edited_by, last_edited_time. IMPORTANT: When changing to 'relation' type, you MUST also provide 'database_id'.
new_type.title: New Type

relation_type.description: Type of relation when new_type is 'relation'. Either 'single_property' or 'dual_property'. Defaults to 'single_property'.
relation_type.title: Relation Type

remove.description: Set to true to remove this property from the database. Cannot be combined with other updates.
remove.title: Remove

rename.description: New name for the property. If None (default), the name remains unchanged.
rename.title: Rename

title.description: New title for the database. Leave as None or omit to keep the existing title unchanged. This updates the database name visible in Notion.
title.title: Title

response_data.description: Updated Notion Database object returned by the action after a schema update. This mirrors Notion's Database object and may include a legacy `properties` map for compatibility with older API responses.
response_data.title: Response Data

data_sources.description: List of child data sources under this database. Each entry summarizes a data source; fetch a data source by ID to get its full schema/properties.
data_sources.title: Data Sources

object.description: Constant identifying the returned object type; always "database".
object.title: Object

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful
